author: Special Correspondent
text:
Artistes giving a performance as part of Sri Brihadambal Aradhanai in Pudukottai on Thursday evening.

A group of young artistes offered musical tribute to Sri Brahadambal and Sri Kokarneswarar here on the occasion of the annual ‘Sri Brahadambal aradhanai’ on Thursday night.

The temple, in the past century, was noted for the ‘veena’ artistes who offered performance every evening at the temple.

Over the years, the system has vanished as artistes had got settled in various parts of the country.

However, the descendants of ‘veena’ artistes, four years ago, volunteered to renew the tradition as an annual event.

The music programmes included nagaswaram, dance recital, and vocal concerts.

“The programme aimed at motivating the descendants to dedicate their talents as a mark of respect to their forefathers,” said R. Karunakaran, Executive Officer of the temple.

Thirty artistes participated in the celebrations and presented various concerts.
title: 30 artistes perform at ‘Brahadambal Aradhanai’
